translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Vibhīṣaṇa
The Elder Koladāyaka’s Birth Story
I was clothed in antelope hide,
wearing a garment of bark,
when I filled a bowl with rice,
and gave it to the Buddha.
At that time the Buddha Sikhī,
was alone, without a companion,🔽and knowing the right time for everything,
he came to me.
I delighted in my own mind,🔽and worshipped him well,
and with both hands I lifted up
the rice and gave it to the Buddha.

analyzed: ekatise itas kappe  yam phalamadadim tadā
translated: For thirty-one eons
I did not know a bad destination,🔽this was the fruit of giving the rice,
the corruptions were burned up for me.
… I live without corruption.
It was good for me to come,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Koladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā koladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Koladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā koladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽koladāyaka therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: The Elder Koladāyaka’s Birth Story, the second.
